wikipedia_page.main:
Nina Nannar is a British Asian journalist.
Brought up in Scunthorpe, North Lincolnshire, she worked on Midlands Today, Children in Need (1999–2000) and the BBC News's 2000 Today.
She joined ITN in March 2001 as the media and arts correspondent for ITV News, later becoming a News Correspondent. 
On 13 December 2016 it was announced Nannar is to become Arts Editor from 2017.

response: The spelling of the title – with the ⟨j⟩ intended to be pronounced like the ⟨y⟩ in yes, rendering the song closer to "Ninanayna" – caused both BBC commentators some difficulty. The title was variously pronounced "Ninanyanya" and "Ninanarna", as well as being misinterpreted to be the name of a British news reporter, with one commentator remarking "Nina Nannar, wherever you are, she wants to dance for you".
